com.chdryra.android.mygenerallibrary

Class DialogTwoButtonFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • DialogFragment
      • com.chdryra.android.mygenerallibrary.DialogTwoButtonFragment
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DialogAlert, DialogThreeButtonFragment 

    public abstract class DialogTwoButtonFragment
extends DialogFragment
    A standard unified look and action for 2 button dialogs. Dialogs often have to do quite similar things that rarely require more than 2 or 3 buttons.

    Subclasses need to override createDialogUI() to return a View (similar to onCreateView(.) in fragments) that defines the look of the Dialog. This method is called by onCreateDialog(.).

    There are a bunch of functions that can be called in the onCreate(.) method when inheriting from this class to tailor the behaviour of the dialog for example dialog title, button labels, button actions, dismiss dialog on button press etc.

    See Also:
    #createDialogUI(android.view.ViewGroup), #onCreateDialog(android.os.Bundle), DialogThreeButtonFragment, DialogAlert

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DialogTwoButtonFragment.ActionType
      Enum that provides ActionResultCodes and associated labels for some common actions.

    • Method Detail

      • createDialogUI

        protected abstract View createDialogUI(ViewGroup parent)
        Subclasses need to override this to return the dialog UI to show above the Dialog buttons.
        Parameters:
        parent: - by default a LinearLayout that will hold the return View followed by the buttons. If the View is inflated from an XML file using a layout inflater, "parent" should be passed as the parent ViewGroup parameter to the inflater.
        Returns:
        View: the view to show above the buttons in the dialog.
        See Also:
        #onCreateDialog(android.os.Bundle)

      • onCreateDialog

        public Dialog onCreateDialog(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Takes output of createDialogUI(.), adds buttons from getButtons(.) and builds and returns a Dialog. Can override the method onCreate(.) to set other parameters using the methods available in this class. This method will be called afterwards.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState -
        Returns:
        Dialog: Dialog built using createDialogUI(.) and getButtons(.).
        See Also:
        #createDialogUI(android.view.ViewGroup), #getButtons(android.view.ViewGroup), #onCreate(android.os.Bundle)

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        By default sets up left button as "Cancel" and right button as "DONE". Can override this to set up other button actions and button/dialog behaviour to tailor the Dialog. See the other methods for parameters that can be set.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState -

      • onLeftButtonClick

        protected void onLeftButtonClick()
        By default sends the ActivityResultCode bound to the left button.
        See Also:
        setLeftButtonAction(ActionType), setLeftButtonResultCode(ActivityResultCode)

      • onRightButtonClick

        protected void onRightButtonClick()
        By default sends the ActivityResultCode bound to the right button.
        See Also:
        setRightButtonAction(DialogTwoButtonFragment.ActionType), setRightButtonResultCode(ActivityResultCode)

      • setLeftButtonResultCode

        protected void setLeftButtonResultCode(ActivityResultCode resultCode)
        The result code to bind to the left button. By default, onLeftButtonClick() sends this result code to the commissioning activity.
        Parameters:
        resultCode: - the ActivityResultCode to bind to the button.
        See Also:
        onLeftButtonClick(), ActivityResultCode

      • setRightButtonResultCode

        protected void setRightButtonResultCode(ActivityResultCode resultCode)
        The result code to bind to the right button. By default, onRightButtonClick() sends this result code to the commissioning activity.
        Parameters:
        resultCode: - the ActivityResultCode to bind to the button.
        See Also:
        onRightButtonClick(), ActivityResultCode

        leftButtonText: - the button label.

        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • getTitleForAction

        protected java.lang.String getTitleForAction(DialogTwoButtonFragment.ActionType type)
        Looks up titles for the given ActionType. By default uses the labels bound to that ActionType.
        Parameters:
        type: - ActionType to find the label for.
        Returns:
        String: the label.

        protected void setDialogTitle(java.lang.String dialogTitle)

        protected Intent getNewReturnData()
        Initialises and returns new Intent data that will be passed to the commissioning activity if a button is pressed.
        Returns:
        Intent: holds the return data.

      • getReturnData

        protected Intent getReturnData()

        Returns:
        Intent: holds the return data.

      • sendResult

        protected void sendResult(ActivityResultCode resultCode)
        Sends the ActivityResultCode passed to the commissioning activity and dismisses Dialog if necessary.
        Parameters:
        resultCode: - the result code to send to the commissioning activity.

      • getButtons

        protected View getButtons(ViewGroup parent)
        Returns a button layout with appropriate actions and labels. Called by onCreateDialog(.).
        Parameters:
        parent: - by default a LinearLayout that will hold the return View followed by the buttons. If the View is inflated from an XML file using a layout inflater, "parent" should be passed as the parent ViewGroup parameter to the inflater.
        Returns:
        View: the main UI for the Dialog.
        See Also:
        #onCreateDialog(android.os.Bundle)
